page.title: 16 THE BOAT RACE
page.content: The stretch of the Thames in south Chiswick has 5 boathouses and is used for the Oxford and Cambridge Boat Race. This starts at Putney and ends opposite Watneys Brewery. At the end of the race they cheer the losing team and throw the cox in the water. In the autumn they go out training one at a time in sculls and they choose the best crew from 50 people. These go out in a boat and train for 4 hours a day. They do 20 miles a day and 120 a week. They have to be able to lift 200 kilogram weights the first time and they are very strong. The boats are made of fibreglass and cost 10,000 pounds to buy. When they have races they get very tired. They have one day off as well. The crew must think together and must work together as a team.
